    Estimating ancestry proportions Imputing Z-scores of unmeasured SNPs

Estimating ancestry proportions

Source: vignettes/afmix_example.Rmd
afmix_example.Rmd

In this vignette, we will illustrate how to use the afmix() function, which is designed to compute ethnic mixing proportions for a multi-ethnic GWAS dataset.

# Load necessary packages
library(gauss)
library(dplyr)
library(data.table)
library(kableExtra)

The afmix() function requires four arguments:

  1. Path to the input file.
  2. Path to the reference panel index file (i.e., reference_index_file).
  3. Path to the reference data file (i.e., reference_data_file).
  4. Path to the reference population description file (i.e., reference_pop_desc_file).

The input file should include six columns with the following column names: rsid (SNP ID), chr (chromosome number), bp (base pair position), a1 (reference allele), a2 (alternative allele), and af1 (reference allele frequency).

Firstly, we will assign the path to an input file containing rsid, chr, bp, a1, a2 and af1.

# Path to the input file
input_file <- "/Users/leed13/Desktop/GAUSS/GWAS_data/PGC/PGC2/PGC2_final/ilmn1M/pgc2.chr22.ilmn1M.Af1only.txt"

# Input file should include six columns (rsid, chr, bp, a1, a2, and af1)
input.data <- fread(input_file, header = TRUE)
head(input.data)
#>         rsid chr       bp a1 a2       af1
#> 1: rs1000427  22 36890105  A  G 0.1159800
#> 2: rs1000470  22 24026845  A  C 0.1240050
#> 3: rs1000539  22 20202729  A  G 0.2660650
#> 4:   rs10009  22 22051709  A  G 0.6319500
#> 5: rs1001022  22 26403488  T  C 0.9570250
#> 6: rs1001213  22 34131736  A  G 0.0667805

Next, we will assign the paths to reference data files to variables

# Paths to the reference files (replace these with your actual paths)
reference_index_file<-"/path/to/33kg_index.gz"
reference_data_file <- "/path/to/33kg_geno.gz"
reference_pop_desc_file<-"path/to/33kg_pop_desc.txt"

Lastly, we will execute the afmix() function to compute the ethnic mixing proportions and display the results in a neat table.

wgt.df <- afmix(input_file=input_file,
                reference_index_file = reference_index_file,
                reference_data_file = reference_data_file,
                reference_pop_desc_file = reference_pop_desc_file)
wgt.df %>% kable("html")
sup.pop pop wgt
AFR ACB 0.006
AFR ASW 0.036
SAS BEB 0.005
ASN CCE 0.008
ASN CCS 0.004
ASN CDX 0.018
EUR CEU 0.165
AMR CLM 0.025
ASN CNE 0.003
ASN CSE 0.012
EUR FIN 0.138
EUR GBR 0.165
SAS GIH 0.006
EUR IBS 0.099
ASN JPT 0.011
ASN KHV 0.017
AMR MXL 0.030
EUR ORK 0.166
SAS PJL 0.016
AMR PUR 0.045
EUR TSI 0.086

Here, we obtain the total proportion for each super population and display the results in a table.

wgt.df %>%
  group_by(sup.pop) %>%
  summarise(wgt=sum(wgt), .groups="drop") %>%
  kable("html")
sup.pop wgt
AFR 0.042
AMR 0.100
ASN 0.073
EUR 0.819
SAS 0.027
